content: All users will be added with User permissions only. To be able to add further admins, <1>click here</1> to upgrade your tariff plan.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message to non-admin users informing them that they have reached their tariff plan limit and can upgrade to add admin permissions. The message appears as a button in the UI, allowing users to click "here" to upgrade their plan.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are not properly closed in the Arabic translation. The opening tag is present, but the closing tag isn't correctly placed. It appears intended to highlight a link.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1> انقر هنا </1> should be properly formatted using HTML tags to ensure the link is correctly rendered.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "To be able to add further admins" is not accurately translated. "Daha çox administrator əlavə etmək üçün" is a literal translation but sounds awkward. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of "Administratorların sayısını artırmaq üçün" or "Daha çox administrator qoşmaq üçün".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Administratorların sayısını artırmaq üçün

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'click here' is translated as 'buraya klikləyin'. While technically correct, a more common and natural phrasing in Azerbaijani would be something like 'yenə baxın' or 'bu linkə klikləyin'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: bu linkə klikləyin

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'upgrade your tariff plan' is translated as 'tarif planınızı təkmilləşdirin'. While not entirely wrong, 'yüksəltin' would be a more common and natural translation of 'upgrade' in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: tarif planınızı yüksəldin

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is used inconsistently in both the English and Bulgarian content. While the English uses it as a generic placeholder, the Bulgarian interpretation of this tag might need to be a specific link tag (e.g., `<a>`) to function correctly in the UI. Assuming this is a clickable element, the format should be updated.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace `<1>натиснете тук` with `<1>натиснете тук . The [link] should be replaced with the actual URL to the tariff upgrade page.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'To be able to add further admins' is awkwardly translated as 'Abyste mohli přidávat další administrátory'. A more natural translation would be something along the lines of 'Pro přidávání dalších administrátorů'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pro přidávání dalších administrátorů

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English sentence 'click here to upgrade your tariff plan' is translated as '<1>klikněte zde</1> a upgradujte tarifní plán'.  The conjunction 'a' (and) creates a slightly unnatural phrasing.  A more fluent translation would omit it.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>klikněte zde</1> upgradujte tarifní plán.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "to be able to add further admins" is not accurately translated. 'Voidaksesi lisätä pääkäyttäjiä' is a literal translation that sounds awkward. A more natural phrasing would be 'Jotta voit lisätä lisää pääkäyttäjiä' or 'Lisää pääkäyttäjiä varten'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jotta voit lisätä lisää pääkäyttäjiä

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> seem to have been carried over without purpose. They are unnecessary and should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags around 'klikkaa tästä'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "To be able to add further admins" is not accurately translated. "Այլ ադմիններ ավելացնելու համար" literally translates to 'To add other admins'. The English implies ability to add admins beyond the current limit.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to something like "ավելին ադմիններ ավելացնելու համար" (to add more admins) or "ադմիններ ավելացնելու համար, եթե ձեր գործունեությունը դրա կարիք ունի" (to add admins, if your activity requires it).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>click here</1>` are not consistently rendered in the Armenian translation. The `<1>` tag is used, but `</1>` appears as `</1>`.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag rendering. The closing tag should also be `<1>`.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent in the original English and Italian text. The English uses angle brackets, while the Italian uses a different form of HTML-like tags. This suggests a potential formatting error during the translation process where the tags weren't properly converted.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of angle brackets (< >) or a consistent style of HTML-like tags across the original and translated text. If the intention is to use angle brackets, replace the tags with < >. If the intention is to use a specific tag style, standardize on that style.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is inconsistent with the English version. It seems intended to highlight a clickable link, but in Japanese, it's just raw HTML.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace `<1>` with a proper HTML link tag, e.g., `こちら` or use a styling approach to highlight the text without using HTML tags directly.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is not properly closed in the Korean translation. It appears to be used to mark the clickable area but is inconsistent with the English source.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the HTML tag `<1>` is consistently applied and correctly closed. Consider using a standard anchor tag `여기를 클릭` if the Korean text is meant to be a hyperlink.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is inconsistent with standard formatting practices. It seems to indicate a clickable element, but the use of `<1>` is unusual.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the clickable element uses standard HTML formatting like Click here or a more appropriate styling method.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation of "click here" ("ກົດບ່ອນນີ້") is generally correct, but in this context, a more formal phrasing might be more appropriate for a user interface element addressed to administrators.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more formal phrase like "ກົດທີ່ນີ້" or "ລຸ່ມນີ້" which translates more closely to 'click here' or 'below this' respectively. The best option depends on the overall tone of the interface.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent. The English uses <1> and </1>, but the Polish uses the same. This might cause rendering issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tags. If the intent is to highlight, use the same tags as the source (e.g., <1> and </1>).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "To be able to add further admins" is not perfectly translated. "Pentru a adăuga administratori în continuare" is a literal translation but sounds slightly awkward in Romanian. A more natural phrasing would be something like "Pentru a putea adăuga și administratori" or "Dacă doriți să adăugați administratori".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pentru a putea adăuga și administratori

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are not standard and might not render correctly. It is unclear what their purpose is intended to be.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the purpose of the tags. If it's intended to be a link, use standard HTML `<a>` tags. If it's for styling, ensure proper CSS is applied or use a more common formatting method.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "To be able to add further admins" is not accurately translated. "තවත් පරිපාලකයන් එකතු කිරීමට" is closer to "to add more admins," but the nuance of 'to be able to' is lost. A better translation might focus on enabling the ability to add admins.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: තවත් පරිපාලකයන් යෙදවීමට හැකිවන පරිදි

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with common practices for indicating placeholder spans. They may confuse users or systems interpreting the translated text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace <1> and </1> with a more standard placeholder marker, such as {{link_start}} and {{link_end}}, or a more descriptive identifier.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'click here to upgrade your tariff plan' is translated as 'kliknite sem a aktualizujte svoj tarifný plán'. While technically correct, 'aktualizujte' (update) implies a change to an existing plan, whereas 'upgrade' suggests moving to a higher tier. A more accurate translation might use a term indicating plan expansion or an increased limit.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: kliknite sem a rozšírte svoj tarifný plán

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with the English version, where it's just a hyperlink. The Slovenian translation has mismatched opening/closing HTML tags.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>kliknite tukaj</1> should be changed to something like: [Kliknite tukaj](link_to_upgrade_page)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are not standard for marking up text. They should be removed or replaced with a more appropriate method.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags `<1>` and `</1>`.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "To be able to add further admins" is translated as "Da biste mogli dalje da dodajete admine". While understandable, a more natural and precise translation would be "Da biste mogli da dodajete dodatne admine" or "Da biste mogli dodavati još admine".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Da biste mogli da dodajete dodatne admine

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1>click here</1> appear as is in the Serbian translation. They should be adapted to the Serbian language. A better approach would be `<1>kliknite ovde</1>.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>kliknite ovde</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "click here" is translated as "buraya tıklayın". While technically correct, it's a more literal translation. A more natural and user-friendly translation would be something like "yükseltmek için tıklayın" or "güncellemek için tıklayın".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: yükseltmek için tıklayın

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is inconsistent. It's used to highlight the call to action 'click here'. Consider using a more standard HTML tag or a CSS class for styling.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace `<1>` with a CSS class or a more appropriate HTML tag, e.g., `click here` or `click here

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "підвищте тарифний план" (upgrade your tariff plan) could be more naturally translated as "оновити тарифний план" (update your tariff plan).  'Підвищити' implies an increase in value, while 'оновити' is a more common phrasing for tariff upgrades.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change "підвищте тарифний план" to "оновити тарифний план".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with the English version. The English version uses <1>click here</1>. The Vietnamese translation uses <1>nhấp vào đây</1>. This suggests a possible misalignment of the tagging.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistency in HTML tags. If the intention is to highlight 'nhấp vào đây', use the same tags as the English version or a more appropriate styling approach.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and are inconsistent with standard practice. They should be replaced with a more consistent format, such as and or and , depending on the intended style.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using and or and for the hyperlink tags. For example: 点击此处
